sn13.7:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose a man was to draw up two or three drops of water from the ocean.
sn13.7:1.4: Which is more: the two or three drops drawn out or the water in the ocean?”
sn13.7:2.1: “Sir, the water in the ocean is certainly more.
sn13.7:2.2: The two or three drops drawn out are tiny.
sn13.7:2.3: Compared to the water in the ocean, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part.”
sn13.7:2.4: “In the same way, for a noble disciple, the suffering that’s over and done with is more …”
